He said that he had not forgotten any of the things that were left behind on his journey.

This is a very common phrase in Finnish when someone says they have not forgotten something or someone else's things. It often means they have made up their minds to do something again after a period of time and want to keep track of it. This can be used for many different situations, such as planning a trip, making a new purchase, or remembering lost items.

Source: Sen miksi leveä leuka ei tuntunut sopivan omaan kehoon ja miksi rinta­lihasten tuli olla pyöreät tasaisen rintakehän sijaan.

Translation:
Translate the following text from fi to en: Sen miksi leveä leuka ei tuntunut sopivan omaan kehoon ja miksi rinta­lihasten tuli olla pyöreät tasaisen rintakehän sijaan. 

English:

What is the difference between a leukaemia patient and a chemotherapy patient? Why are they different?

The answer is that leukaemia patients have to take an immunosuppressant drug, which makes them less likely to respond to chemotherapy drugs.

In contrast, chemotherapy patients do not need to take such drugs because their body already has a strong immune system that can fight off cancer cells. They receive chemotherapy as part of a treatment plan for cancer and are usually given more aggressive treatments than those needed to kill all the cancer cells.

So why do leukaemia patients need to take the immunosuppressant drug? Is it so that their bodies don't attack their own healthy cells when they're sick? Or is it that they are taking too much of this drug, making it ineffective against the disease?
